alston.minecraft

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockItem, EmptyItem, SimpleItem, Tool

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable
    A generalization of all the types of Items stacks, and holds all essential variables and handles interactions that occurs between them.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ITEMS

        public static final Item[] ITEMS
        Prototype of every Item in the game. It is not used by the game per se, but is used to be cloned, where the clones are the actual Items being used.

      • itemSpatialsMap

        public static final java.util.HashMap itemSpatialsMap
        Maps the Spatials to the Item for collision detection.

        protected static final com.jme3.audio.AudioNode place

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(int type,
    com.jme3.scene.Spatial spatial,
    com.jme3.ui.Picture picture)
        Constructor for an Will never directly be called during an instantiation, but will be called from the subclass' constructor. Default maxAmount is 64, and amount is 1.
        Parameters:
        type - An integer representation of what item it is. Used to help organize and keep track of Objects in the program.
        spatial - The spatial of the Item when thrown or equipped

      • Item

        public Item(int type,
    com.jme3.scene.Spatial spatial,
    com.jme3.ui.Picture picture,
    int maxAmount)
        Constructor for an Item, with a pre-defined maximum amount. Will never directly be called during an instantiation, but will be called from the subclass' constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - An integer representation of what item it is. Used to help organize and keep track of Objects in the program.
        maxAmount - The maximum amount of Items that a stack of his can have

    • Method Detail

      • restoreSpatials

        public static void restoreSpatials()
        Restores all the Spatials of items in the scene graph.

      • rightClick

        public abstract void rightClick(int x,
              int y,
              int z,
              int xModifier,
              int yModifier,
              int zModifier)
        Defines what happens when the player right clicks with this
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the block that was clicked on
        y - The y coordinate of the block that was clicked on
        z - The z coordinate of the block that was clicked on
        xModifier - The face in the X axis the block was clicked on
        yModifier - The face in the Y axis the block was clicked on
        zModifier - The face in the Z axis the block was clicked on

      • setAmount

        public void setAmount(int amount)
        Sets the amount of Items the stack of it contains, then updates the Item's BitmapText representation of the amount (number). If the amount is 1, it will not show the amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - The new amount of Items

      • setBarPicture

        public void setBarPicture(com.jme3.ui.Picture barPicture)
        Parameters:
        barPicture - The new picture representing the Item on the inventory bar

      • setParent

        public void setParent(SlotArea parent)
        Parameters:
        parent - The new SlotArea that the Item is attached to

      • setSlotPosition

        public void setSlotPosition(int slotX,
                   int slotY)
        Parameters:
        slotX - The new x coordinate of the Item within the slotArea
        slotY - The new y coordinate of the Item within the slotArea

      • setSpatial

        public void setSpatial(com.jme3.scene.Spatial spatial)
        Parameters:
        spatial - The new Spatial of this Item

      • setControl

        public void setControl(com.jme3.bullet.control.RigidBodyControl control)
        Parameters:
        control - The new physics control for the Item
